title: Vendor Transition Analyst
requirement: Job ID: 434817BR Business Area: CVS Health Primary Location: IL â€’ Buffalo Grove Other Locations: TX - Irving Job Type: Full Time Job Category: Analytics, Audit Clinical Licensure Required: N/A Position Summary: The Vendor Transition Analyst is responsible for audit and quality of handling data files, including but not limited to the audit of data loaded into the system, output files created with data received, or the modification of data before or after it is loaded to the system. The role will require a growth in understanding of the various data files and the general impacts of that data on business teams and other systems, error tracking and reporting of metrics, working constructively with the staff to work through quality issues identified, and make recommendations for quality improvements within the team in general and will help to coach team members on how to perform their functions with more quality outputs. The Analyst will partner with SMEs within the team on process improvement efforts, including on IT projects that enhance support jobs, to develop needed test cases, and will work with the development team to ensure accurate testing outcomes. This role is an extremely detail-oriented job, requiring the ability to audit single bytes of data from start to finish through a process flow and job stream, as well as larger-scale, multi-million record files that get loaded into the system or manipulated for other processes. The ability to give direct but constructive feedback to other team members will help to achieve a successful partnership within the team. The role will require the ability to understand requirements for quality reporting and then develop or work with others to develop the tools needed to deliver those reports. title: Business Analyst
requirement: Job ID: 426771BR Business Area: CVS Health Primary Location: RI â€’ Woonsocket Job Type: Full Time Job Category: Information Systems Clinical Licensure Required: N/A Position Summary: As part of the Identity Access Management team this analyst position is responsible to support the Periodic Access Review (PAR) process. PAR is an Information Security, Compliance, and regulatory requirement to ensure that users have the minimum amount of access needed. At a high level the IT Business Analyst would work to ensure PARs are complete, accurate, and due dates are met. To do so the analyst may be responsible for working on the collection of user access lists from various IT infrastructure teams, performing analysis so as to correlate an account ID to an owner or system owner and reporting manager, and tracking status throughout the PAR cycle. Additionally the PAR analyst may provide managers throughout the enterprise with reports and follow-up on access reviews. The Business Analyst will be expected to develop an understanding of application functions as well as provisioning & de-provisioning activities. The Business Analyst may be assigned to act as point of contact for specific applications and aspects of the certification tasks. The ideal candidate should be able to work independently as well as in a team setting to accomplish specific tasks. requirement: Job ID: 432404BR Business Area: CVS Health Primary Location: AZ â€’ Scottsdale Job Type: Full Time Job Category: Information Systems Clinical Licensure Required: N/A Position Summary: Reinvent your career with the company reinventing healthcare. Join the team at CVS Health . The Medicaid Pharmacy Network Advisor - Senior has a direct impact on how our clients view our compliance with Medicaid regulations and has a direct correlation with their confidence in CVS Health's stability to administer their plans from an individual state and plan oversight perspective. You will serve as a subject matter expert for Medicaid Plan guidance/regulation, as it relates to the pharmacy network and drive implementation to ensure CVS Health is compliant. requirement: Job ID: 449259BR Business Area: CVS Health Primary Location: AZ â€’ Scottsdale Job Type: Full Time Job Category: Information Systems Clinical Licensure Required: N/A Position Summary: The Medicare Part D Explanation of Benefits (EOB) department is responsible for producing a monthly Beneficiary mailing containing the summary of claim activity. title: IT Client Services Advisor
requirement: Job ID: 422503BR Business Area: CVS Health Primary Location: IL â€’ Buffalo Grove Other Locations: RI - Lincoln Job Type: Full Time Job Category: Information Systems Clinical Licensure Required: N/A Position Summary: Join an organization that was voted #3 on the list of the 50 Most Innovative Companies for 2016. As a key member of the IT Client Services team, the IT Client Services Advisor will be responsible for partnering with Legal, Sales, Account Management, and internal Information Technology teams to manage and support Request for Proposal (RFP) and Contract terms and conditions executed back to external clients. You will also serve as the single point of contact between the business areas and technical teams, monitoring and providing current status of contract activities during the pre and post signing phases. Additional duties include: Protect CVS Healthâ€™s interest by enforcing performance/service level guarantees, mitigating risk, and providing oversight to IT area contract management teams. Support preparation of bid evaluation and other technical documents for the RFP process related to clients. Facilitate internal contract approval and stakeholder negotiation to resolve complex issues and assist in disputes (escalating to leaders where appropriate.) Partner with other members of IT, Legal, internal business partners, including senior management as appropriate, in continued efforts to streamline contract/RFP related processes; integrate templates in an effort to improve turnaround times to an increasing client base. Drive ongoing process improvements for all aspects of IT contracting by maintaining templates for all documents. Understand, archive, and provide visibility to all deviations from standard terms for decision support and risk mitigation. Work closely with the legal department to ensure contract provisions are consistent across clients and ensure all applicable standard legal terms are included in the signed contract. Lead and/or participate in cross functional meetings as required; lead internal ad hoc groups to address contracting issues, communicate status of negotiations, and document key financial and legal terms. Drive proactive communication with internal IT and business partners throughout the contracting process, to ensure a complete, executed contract is secured. Communicate formal presentations and regular status to management and business partners. Perform monthly forecasting and reporting on all Performance Guarantees by analyzing and explaining differences between actual results and projections where there is negative impact. Utilize legal resources, and other subject matter experts, to ensure all levels of risk are recognized and subsequently addressed through development of unique contract terms and conditions, to mitigate risks. Brief IT areas, Senior Management, and other functional areas on contractual and business risks; provide guidance where necessary. Serve as the point of contact for Account Teams and internal IT areas on contractual matters. Ensure timely review and approval/reconciliation where deviations occur. Provide redlined recommendations on standard and nonstandard contracts deviations. Maintain and manage repository of contractual changes for future reference. Provide guidance on contract matters to IT Project Managers, Project Owners, and IT Operational Staff. Continue to evolve procedures for RFP and contract management and administration. Establish process to monitor compliance to contract terms with established procedures. Work with IT areas to ensure adherence to Performance Guarantees or other financial implications. Work with IT areas to establish and document standards that should consistently be part of contracts and/or RFPs. Ensure that signed contracts are communicated to all relevant parties to provide contract visibility and awareness; provide interpretation to support implementation. Handle ongoing issue and change management. Monitor transaction compliance (milestones, deliverables, etc.) Oversee Performance Guarantee Management Compliance. Ensure contract close-out, extension, or renewal. The IT Client Services Advisor can be located in our Buffalo Grove, IL or Lincoln, RI offices. #DCE Required Qualifications: 5 or more years of experience in creating Request for Proposal (RFP)/Contract packages and interfacing with multiple disciplines in their creation 5 years of experience working as an Advisor/Analyst 3 years of experience in project management practices â€“ planning, status reporting, issue management, risk mitigation, scope control documentation Proven success drafting complex contract terms and conditions, reviewing contracts for conformity to policies, and identifying and assessing risks Excellent verbal and written communication skills demonstrated by leading cross functional initiatives Proven proficiency with Excel knowledge of advanced functionality Demonstrated understanding of contracts and RFP metrics and KPI Proven ability to adapt to daily changes while success completing tasks Preferred Qualifications: 7 or more years experience in IT Client Services role working directly with client executives and project managers Proven ability to work independently and provide attention to detail Demonstrated success utilizing negotiating, interpersonal, and communication skills Successful use of SDLC methodologies and supporting tool-sets and familiarity and exposure to development environments End-to-end experience with software development methodologies Ability to develop client trust and effectively manage relationships Strong analytical mindset and innovative problem solving skills Ability to analyze complex business needs and facilitate concurrence among stakeholders Fluency in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, SharePoint, Word, Access) Education: BS in computer science/MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience. High School Diploma or GED is a required.
